DOCNAME: CASE OF STEBNITSKIY AND KOMFORT v. UKRAINE
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient
JUDGES: Angelika Nußberger;Ganna Yudkivska;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Julia Laffranque;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The applicant company also has its seat in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG awarded the applicant company , ORG and CARDINAL NORP hryvnas ( ORG ) respectively against the Y. private open joint - stock company . DATE ORG instituted enforcement proceedings .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant company instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG , challenging its inactivity in the enforcement of the above judgments . On DATE the court found for the applicant company and ordered ORG to enforce the judgments . On DATE the ORG of Appeal upheld that judgment .
CARDINAL . The judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE in the applicant company 's favour were enforced by DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant company instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG , claiming ORG in compensation for pecuniary damage ( inflation losses ) caused by the lengthy delay in enforcing the judgments of DATE and DATE in its favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found against the applicant company . On DATE the ORG of Appeal upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Higher Commercial Court of GPE refused to examine an appeal by the applicant company as it had failed to pay a court fee . The applicant company appealed against that decision , arguing that in accordance with section CARDINAL of LAW , the creditor was dispensed from paying court fees in cases against a legal person , entrusted with enforcing a judgment , for compensation for damage sustained as a result of the non - enforcement of a judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed a cassation appeal lodged by the applicant company as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . During DATE the applicant company instituted numerous proceedings against ORG challenging tax payments , fines etc .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the ORG instituted insolvency proceedings in ORG against the applicant company . ORG stated that the applicant company had failed to pay ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in tax in DATE and had already had a tax lien imposed on it . Moreover , the last transaction on the applicant company 's account had taken place DATE and the applicant company 's location was unknown . Apparently , the applicant company was not informed about these proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE , in the applicant company representative 's absence , the court declared the applicant company insolvent for failure to pay ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL in taxes to the ORG budget . ORG was appointed its liquidator .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant company , it was informed about this decision only by letter of DATE . Subsequently , the applicant company requested the court to fix a new time - limit for lodging an appeal against the decision of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the ORG of Appeal refused this request because , in accordance with LAW , the relevant time - limit of DATE from the date on which the appealed judgment or decision had been adopted had expired . On CARDINAL DATE the High Commercial Court of GPE dismissed an appeal by the applicant company against the above decisions for non - compliance with the procedural formalities prescribed by law . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed a cassation appeal lodged by the applicant company .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company requested a review of the decision of DATE in the light of newly established evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG started its consideration of the applicant company 's request .

CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings in the case were stayed pending consideration of the applicant company 's complaint lodged in DATE against the tax administration regarding unlawfulness of the latter 's decision of DATE by which the applicant company had been ordered to make some tax payments and to pay fines .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company 's complaint against the decision of DATE was left without consideration as the applicant company had been declared insolvent . The final decision in this case was taken by ORG of GPE on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed the decision of DATE because the applicant company had not been properly informed about the insolvency proceedings against it . The court also terminated the insolvency proceedings and obliged ORG to publish a refutation of the statement that the applicant company had been declared insolvent .
CARDINAL . In its observations of CARDINAL DATE the applicant company submitted that no such refutation had yet been published .
CARDINAL . On DATE the tax police instituted criminal proceedings against the first applicant for tax evasion . The case was later transferred to a prosecutor 's office for investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG instituted new proceedings against the first applicant for forgery in public office and joined them to the initial ones . On DATE the first applicant was charged with those crimes .

CARDINAL . In DATE the case was transferred to the court and on DATE the ORG of Donetsk started its consideration . DATE and DATE CARDINAL court hearings took place and CARDINAL hearings were postponed for various reasons ( on QUANTITY occasions the first applicant and/or his lawyer failed to appear and on CARDINAL occasion the first applicant was ill ) . Other reasons for postponement of hearings included prosecutor 's and witnesses ' failure to appear , court 's decision that additional evidence should be brought into the court hearing , judge 's being busy with another case or judge 's vacation etc .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court changed the charge against the first applicant to neglect of official duty .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court remitted the case for additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed this decision and remitted the case to ORG for consideration on the merits .
CARDINAL . DATE one hearing took place and QUANTITY hearings were postponed for various reasons ( on QUANTITY occasions the first applicant failed to appear ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed a cassation appeal lodged by the first applicant against the decisions of CARDINAL May and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Donetsk again remitted the case for additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG suspended criminal proceedings “ [ instituted ] for neglect of official duty ” because “ it was impossible to establish who had committed that crime ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed a cassation appeal lodged by the first applicant against the decision of DATE on the ground that such decision could not be appealed in cassation .

CARDINAL . In accordance with section DATE ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , the creditor is entitled to institute court proceedings against a legal person , entrusted with collecting payments from the debtor , for inadequate or non - enforcement of a judgment due to the fault of that legal person . In such cases the creditor is dispensed from paying court fees .
CARDINAL . Section DATE ( CARDINAL ) provides that compensation for damage caused by ORG in enforcement proceedings is to be paid in accordance with the procedure prescribed by law .
CARDINAL . According to paragraph CARDINAL of this letter , a legal person , as referred to in section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , is a tax authority , a bank , and so forth , but not ORG .

CARDINAL . In accordance with section CARDINAL of this Act , after the debtor is declared insolvent by the court , its business activity shall be stopped . The court nominates a liquidator , who takes over the management of the debtor 's assets . Having taken the necessary steps to identify and recover the debtor 's debts and search for the assets , the liquidator shall assess these assets and carry out their sale . Having sold the assets and paid the creditors , the liquidator shall submit a report and the liquidation balance to the court .
